Utterance: Hi again! It’s great to see you back. How have you been since our last session?
Hey! I’ve been alright, just the usual, you know?
That’s good to hear. Last time, we talked about your family and how they’ve been a positive influence in your life. Have you had any family gatherings or events since we last spoke?
Yeah, actually, we had a barbecue last weekend. It was fun, a lot of laughter and food.
That sounds wonderful! How did you feel during that gathering?
I felt really happy, just being around everyone. It’s nice to catch up with family.
That’s great! You mentioned music puts you in a good mood. Did you have any music playing during the barbecue?
Oh yeah! We had a playlist going. Everyone was singing along and dancing a bit.
That sounds like a joyful atmosphere! Are there any particular songs that stand out to you from that day?
Hmm, we played a lot of old school stuff, like some classic rock. Everyone loved it.
Music can really bring people together. Speaking of bringing people together, how has your relationship with your girlfriend been since our last talk?
It’s been good! We’ve been spending more time together, just hanging out and playing games.
That’s nice to hear. Have you had any disagreements or challenges recently?
Not really, just the usual little things, but nothing major.
It’s good that you’re able to manage those little disagreements. You mentioned wanting to start a new business. Have you taken any steps towards that since we last spoke?
I’ve been thinking about it more. I’m planning to learn from my dad and maybe help him out at his shop.
That sounds like a solid plan! What kind of skills do you think you’ll need to develop for that?
I think I’ll need to learn more about customer service and the actual mechanics of cars.
Those are great skills to have! How do you feel about learning those things?
I feel pretty excited about it. I think it’ll be fun to work with my dad.
That’s wonderful! It seems like you have a supportive environment to learn in. Have you thought about any challenges you might face while learning?
Maybe just not messing things up at first. I don’t want to disappoint my dad.
It’s natural to feel that way, but mistakes are part of the learning process. How do you usually cope when you feel anxious about making mistakes?
I usually just try to laugh it off or distract myself with something else.
Humor can definitely be a good way to cope. Have you used any specific strategies to manage anxiety in other areas of your life?
Not really, I just try to keep busy and not overthink things.
Keeping busy can help. Have you noticed any moments where you’ve felt overwhelmed or anxious recently?
I guess sometimes when I think about the future, it gets a bit overwhelming.
That’s understandable. It’s common to feel that way when thinking about big changes. What specifically about the future feels overwhelming to you?
Just the thought of having to find a stable job and making sure I’m doing well in life.
Those are significant concerns. Would it help to break those thoughts down into smaller, more manageable steps?
Yeah, that might help. I guess I could start by focusing on learning at the shop first.
That’s a great approach! Focusing on the present and taking small steps can alleviate some of that pressure. What’s one small step you could take this week?
I could ask my dad to show me some basics about car repairs.
That sounds like a perfect start! How do you feel about setting that as a goal for this week?
I feel good about it! I think it’ll be fun.
I’m glad to hear that! As we wrap up today, is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to discuss?
Not really, I think we covered a lot today.
Great! I’m looking forward to hearing about your experience with your dad in our next session. Take care, and see you soon!
Thanks! See you!
